clinical_study.brief_title: Incubation of Alcohol Craving During Abstinence
clinical_study.official_title: The Neural Mechanisms of the Incubation of Cue-induced Craving in Alcohol Dependence

lead_sponsor.agency: National Institute on Drug Dependence, China

collaborator.agency: National Natural Science Foundation of China

clinical_study.source: National Institute on Drug Dependence, China

brief_summary.textblock: In order to determine whether the 'incubation of craving' phenomenon also occurred in alcoholics, investigators employed an experimental approach to investigate the time course of cue-induced craving in alcoholism. Eighty male participants were randomly divided into Four groups, and they were assessed at 7, 14, 30, and 60 days of abstinence for cue-induced alcohol craving . Another group including 19 patients was repeatedly tested for the cue-induced alcohol craving at the above abstinence days. Other psychological and physiological measures were administered at the four abstinence time points.

detailed_description.textblock: All subjects provided written informed consent after a full explanation of the protocol design.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: changes of alcohol craving measured with visual analogue scales
primary_outcome.time_frame: abstained from alcohol for 7 days, 14 days, 30 days and 60 days

secondary_outcome.measure: blood pressure changes in different abstinence days
skin conductance changes in different abstinence days

biospec_descr.textblock: The blood samples of all participants were collected at each point of withdrawal.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- met the criteria of DSM-IV for alcohol dependence
- aged 18-60 years,male
Exclusion Criteria:
- current or past history of Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fourth Edition (DSM-IV) axis I disorders
- with other serious physical diseases (respiratory disorders, cardiovascular disease and so on)
- other drug abuse except for nicotine
